content:
my code failed on validator 3 sadly and ended up with 75%. please fix this:
n=$<.gets.to_i
a=n.times.map{gets.to_i}
p=a.reduce :*
puts a.map{_1.zero?? a.count(0)>1?0:p :p/_1}*' '

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and clean ! good !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: well explained task very good addition to clash of code

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Comments understood, code changed

Goal section
* You won't be able to enforce the rule of "not using division" on players. Please delete that requirement.

* Please change "output i" to "[[i]]-th output".

* Please change "nums i" to "[[i]]-th number".

* Please change "nums" to "numbers".

Input section
* Please delete everything up to "Input:".

* Please delete the two inequalities.

Output section
* Please delete "An array of size".

* Please change "containing" to "space-separated".

* Please change ", where the ith integer is the product of all the elements of nums except numsi." to "as described in Goal section".

Constraints section
* Please revise the limits to reflect the range of values actually tested.

Thanks.
